verses.kjv: Now Benjamin begat Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,
verses.ct: Benjamin became the father of his firstborn Bela, then Ashbel the 2nd, and Aharah the 3rd,

verses.kjv: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
verses.ct: Nohah the 4th, and Rapha the 5th.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Bela were, Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,
verses.ct: Bela's sons were Addar, Gera, and Abihud,

verses.kjv: And Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,
verses.ct: along with Abishua, Naaman, and Ahoah,

verses.kjv: And Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.
verses.ct: as well as Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.

verses.kjv: And these are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath:
verses.ct: These were Ehud's descendants. They were the clan leaders among the people living in Geba, and they were relocated to Manahath:

verses.kjv: And Naaman, and Ahiah, and Gera, he removed them, and begat Uzza, and Ahihud.
verses.ct: Naaman, Ahiah, and Gera — he relocated them and became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

verses.kjv: And Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.
verses.ct: Shaharaim had children in the land of Moab after he divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.

verses.kjv: And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,
verses.ct: Through his wife Hodesh, he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcham,

verses.kjv: And Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These were his sons, heads of the fathers.
verses.ct: Jeuz, Shachia, and Mirma. These sons became clan leaders.

verses.kjv: And of Hushim he begat Abitub, and Elpaal.
verses.ct: Through Hushim he had already become the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

verses.kjv: The sons of Elpaal; Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono, and Lod, with the towns thereof:
verses.ct: Elpaal's sons were Eber, Misham, and Shamed, who built the towns of Ono and Lod along with their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: Beriah also, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath:
verses.ct: Beriah and Shema were also clan leaders among the residents of Aijalon, and they drove out the people living in Gath.

verses.kjv: And Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,
verses.ct: Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,

verses.kjv: And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,
verses.ct: Zebadiah, Arad, and Ader,

verses.kjv: And Michael, and Ispah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah;
verses.ct: Michael, Ispah, and Joha were all sons of Beriah.

verses.kjv: And Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hezeki, and Heber,
verses.ct: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hezeki, and Heber,

verses.kjv: Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;
verses.ct: along with Ishmerai, Jezliah, and Jobab were sons of Elpaal.

verses.kjv: And Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,
verses.ct: Jakim, Zichri, and Zabdi,

verses.kjv: And Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,
verses.ct: Elienai, Zilthai, and Eliel,

verses.kjv: And Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;
verses.ct: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were sons of Shimhi.

verses.kjv: And Ishpan, and Heber, and Eliel,
verses.ct: Ishpan, Heber, and Eliel,

verses.kjv: And Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,
verses.ct: Abdon, Zichri, and Hanan,

verses.kjv: And Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,
verses.ct: Hananiah, Elam, and Antothijah,

verses.kjv: And Iphedeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;
verses.ct: Iphedeiah and Penuel were sons of Shashak.

verses.kjv: And Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,
verses.ct: Shamsherai, Shehariah, and Athaliah,

verses.kjv: And Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.
verses.ct: Jaresiah, Eliah, and Zichri were sons of Jeroham.

verses.kjv: These were heads of the fathers, by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: All of these were clan leaders listed by their family lines — prominent men who lived in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon; whose wife’s name was Maachah:
verses.ct: The founder of Gibeon lived in Gibeon, and his wife's name was Maachah.

verses.kjv: And his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,
verses.ct: His firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, and Nadab,

verses.kjv: And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.
verses.ct: then Gedor, Ahio, and Zacher.

verses.kjv: And Mikloth begat Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against them.
verses.ct: Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. They also settled near their relatives in Jerusalem, living alongside them.

verses.kjv: And Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.ct: Ner became the father of Kish, Kish became the father of Saul, and Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

verses.kjv: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal begat Micah.
verses.ct: Jonathan's son was Meribbaal, and Meribbaal became the father of Micah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.
verses.ct: Micah's sons were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.

verses.kjv: And Ahaz begat Jehoadah; and Jehoadah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza,
verses.ct: Ahaz became the father of Jehoadah, and Jehoadah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.

verses.kjv: And Moza begat Binea: Rapha was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son:
verses.ct: Moza became the father of Binea. Binea's son was Rapha, whose son was Eleasah, whose son was Azel.

verses.kjv: And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.ct: Azel had 6 sons, and their names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All of these were Azel's sons.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Eshek his brother were, Ulam his firstborn, Jehush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
verses.ct: His brother Eshek's sons were Ulam the firstborn, Jehush the 2nd, and Eliphelet the 3rd.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons’ sons, an hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin.
verses.ct: Ulam's descendants were skilled warriors and expert archers. They had many sons and grandsons — 150 in all. All of these belonged to the tribe of Benjamin.
